content:
It sounds like you had an amazing time at the BBQ festival! Trying out different BBQ styles and flavors is a great way to broaden your horizons and find new inspirations. And, of course, it's even more exciting when you discover a new favorite, like the slow-smoked brisket from Smoke and Dreams.

I'm curious, what was it about the brisket from Smoke and Dreams that really stood out to you? Was it the tenderness, the flavor profile, or something else entirely? And did you happen to talk to the pitmasters or owners of Smoke and Dreams to learn more about their smoking process and wood choices?

Also, since you're looking to try out new types of wood chips, I'd be happy to provide some recommendations based on your preferences. Do you have a particular flavor profile in mind that you're aiming for, or are you open to exploring different options?
